page_content:
Load Data Files

Version:MissionOS_2.0

 

Upload Data Files

 

You can upload raw instrumentation data files into MissionOS application using this feature in Instrumentation Load Data Files page.

You can perform the following steps to access this page:

  1. Log into the MissionOS portal.
  2. Click open the Data Manager.

 

 

In Data Manager, navigate to Instrumentation > Data > Load Data Files

The Upload Files tab appears selected by default. The process adopted is you download the sample file of the required instrument and then enter the data and finally perform the upload of the file.

Follow the steps below to upload raw instrumentation data files into the system:

  1. Select the Instrumentation Class.
  2. Select the required Instrumentation Object Type.
  3. Select the Instrumentation Object SubType.
  4. Click Download Data File.
    The sample file gets downloaded into your system.
  5. Enter the instrument data into the excel sheet.
  6. Click the icon at MGS Standard Template to choose the required file.
  7. Click Upload File.
  8. Click the icon at GDL Compliant Files to choose the corresponding file.
  9. Select the configuration required from dropdown field that appears.
  10. Click Upload to load the GDL file.

 

 

 

Load Data Files - History

 

Once you upload raw instrumentation data files into the system using the Upload feature in Load Data Files page, you can view its history as you go to History tab.

To view the history of uploads, first perform the following tasks:

  1. Log into the MissionOS portal.
  2. Click open the Data Manager.

In Data Manager, navigate to Instrumentation > Data > Load Data Files.

The Upload Files tab appears selected by default. The process adopted is you download the sample file of the required instrument and then enter the data and finally perform the upload of the file.

To search and view history of file uploads, perform the following steps:

  1. After upload of data files, click History
    The History tab opens.
  2. Enter the Instrument ID for which you must view the history of data files.
  3. Select the Instrument Type.
  4. Select the date range if further filtering is required.
  5. Click Search.
    A list of files appears, each of which you can download.
  6. To download a specific file, click Download.
